BR_text.BRdescription:
On <denchmark-link:https://github.com/aws/sagemaker-python-sdk/blob/4bac1856926ed9446f160d0b2e5554dac7bfb6a0/src/sagemaker/local/image.py#L316>line 316 of sagemaker.local.image</denchmark-link>
  there is a reference to  but the module is not imported. Therefore we get an error:
 <denchmark-code>AttributeError: module 'sagemaker' has no attribute 'rl'
 </denchmark-code>
 
 The fix is also not trivial, because if you try adding the needed import at the top of the file you incur in an import loop.
 To trigger this code I created an estimator, passing to it an output_path starting with "file://" and then called its fit method.

comments_0.comment_text:
Hello <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tyrion>@tyrion</denchmark-link>
 ,
 Can you please provide a minimal repro for us to try?
 The image or dataset doesn't have to be provided.
 Thanks!

comments_1.comment_text:
Hello <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ChoiByungWook>@ChoiByungWook</denchmark-link>
 ,
 here you go:
 from sagemaker import get_execution_role
 from sagemaker.estimator import Estimator
 from sagemaker.local import LocalSession
 
 role = get_execution_role()
 
 session = LocalSession()
 session.config = {'local': {'local_code': True,}}
 
 est = Estimator(
     image_name='nope',
     output_path="file:///anything",
     train_instance_type='local',
     train_instance_count=1,
     role=role,
     sagemaker_session=session,
 )
 
 est.fit()

comments_2.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/tyrion>@tyrion</denchmark-link>
 ,
 Thank you so much.
 I will begin by reproducing this issue.
 For now, I will reference the pull request that added in the code path that caused this error: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/aws/sagemaker-python-sdk/pull/524>#524</denchmark-link>

 ,
 Thank you so much for bringing this to our attention. We made our fix here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/aws/sagemaker-python-sdk/pull/560>#560</denchmark-link>
 
 Please let us know if this solves your issue.
